intro: Ageratina urbani, commonly known as the urban ageratina, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, white to pale blue florets arranged in a dense, spherical cluster, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique texture. Ageratina urbani thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
